conclusion: Problem involves finding temperature in state D of an ideal gas cycle.
p-V diagram with points A, B, C, D; BC is a hyperbola.
BC is an isothermal process because pv = constant.
A to B: Pressure constant at 4 atm, volume increases from 10 L to 20 L.
B to C: Pressure decreases from 4 atm to 2 atm, volume increases from 20 L to 40 L.
C to D: Pressure constant at 2 atm, volume decreases from 40 L to 20 L.
Temperature at state A is 300 K.
Use isobaric process formula to find temperature at B.
B to C is isothermal, so TB = TC = 600 K.
Use isobaric process formula to find temperature at D.
Assume constant amount of gas and ideal gas behavior.
Final temperature in state D is 300 K.
